page.title: 05TRANSPORT WORK IN NENTHEAD
page.content: Moredun Garage set up business in a shed near the school in 1965. That is now used to spray vehicles. Main premises are now at Holmsfoot_formerly they were used to make carts to take minerals to Alston. Four full_time people are employed. Petrol was sold from 1971_79 when it became no longer viable. Business is decreasing though car repair rates are reasonable at Â£7 per hour. Its future is seen as bleak. Moredun do snow clearance for the council and provide ambulance service. Wright Bros. set up business in 1924 obtaining their present premises in 1967 from a Belgian smelting company. It employs 4 full-time,4 part-time drivers,2 mechanics,2 directors,1 secretary and 1 cleaner.Three buses a day travel to Newcastle_return fare is 3.50.They provide school transport and do holiday trips abroad.
